what: USAID Flood Response – Post Intervention Survey (Mulanje, 2019–2020)
title: USAID Flood Response – Post Intervention Survey (Mulanje, 2019–2020)
text: dataset contains detailed post-intervention monitoring data rural water points Mulanje district Malawi, collected part USAID Flood Response program 2019 2020. Using mWater mobile data collection platform, enumerators conducted -site assessments water point conditions following flood recovery efforts. data captures comprehensive range water point characteristics, including physical condition photographs, operational performance pumps, hydraulic measurements time effort required pump standard volume water. Additionally, water quality parameters rigorously tested—covering chemical contaminants like arsenic, ammonia, fluoride, nitrate, free chlorine, total dissolved solids, well physical indicators pH, temperature, turbidity. Microbiological quality assessed via E. coli concentrations, including counts per 100 milliliters, confidence intervals, risk classifications, supported photographic documentation test results. indicators provide critical insight safety usability water sources flood-related disruptions.

title: USAID Flood Response – Post Intervention Survey (Mulanje, 2019–2020)
text: dataset serves multiple practical purposes water management public health: Evaluating effectiveness flood recovery interventions water infrastructure. Monitoring water quality trends identify ongoing emerging contamination risks. Informing maintenance rehabilitation priorities based pump performance structural assessments. Supporting public health risk assessments microbial contamination data. Providing evidence community-level decision making donor reporting. Guiding future emergency preparedness response planning water systems flood-prone areas.

title: USAID Flood Response – Post Intervention Survey (Mulanje, 2019–2020)
text: dataset highly valuable range stakeholders including: Government agencies responsible water supply sanitation, particularly district national levels. International donor organizations development partners managing WASH disaster recovery programs. Field engineers technical teams engaged infrastructure repair monitoring. Public health officials tracking waterborne disease risks. Researchers studying environmental health, water security, climate resilience. NGOs civil society organizations supporting community water management advocacy.

title: USAID Flood Response – Post Intervention Survey (Mulanje, 2019–2020)
text: package provides access post-intervention monitoring data rural water points Mulanje district Malawi, collected part USAID Flood Response program 2019 2020.

title: USAID Flood Response – Post Intervention Survey (Mulanje, 2019–2020)
text: dataset postfloodintervention contains 308 observations 30 variables overview variable names, see following table.

title: USAID Flood Response – Post Intervention Survey (Mulanje, 2019–2020)
code: library(postfloodintervention)  # Water Quality Parameters # Purpose: Multi-panel boxplots for chemical indicators (arsenic, fluoride, nitrate, ammonia, free chlorine, pH) to detect outliers or contamination patterns.  # Load libraries library(tidyverse)  # Select relevant chemical columns and pivot longer for plotting chemicals_long <- postfloodintervention %>%   select(arsenic_magnitude, fluoride_ppm, nitrate_mg_per_l, ammonia_mg_per_l, free_chlorine_mg_per_l, ph) %>%   pivot_longer(     cols = everything(),     names_to = "chemical",     values_to = "value"   ) %>%   filter(!is.na(value))  # Remove missing values  # Plot multi-panel boxplots ggplot(chemicals_long, aes(x = chemical, y = value)) +   geom_boxplot(fill = "#4a90e2", outlier.color = "red") +   facet_wrap(~ chemical, scales = "free") +   # Free y-scale per chemical   labs(     title = "Water Quality Parameters: Chemical Indicators",     x = NULL,     y = "Concentration"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(axis.text.x = element_blank(),   # Hide x labels since facets show names         axis.ticks.x = element_blank())

title: USAID Flood Response - Post Intervention Survey 2019-2020 — postfloodintervention
text: dataset represents USAID Flood Response Post Intervention Survey conducted Mulanje 2019-2020 using mWater platform. contains comprehensive water quality assessments operational data various water points affected flooding.

electrical_conductivity_magnitude Measured magnitude electrical conductivity water sample electrical_conductivity_units Units electrical conductivity measurement (e.g., uS/cm) arsenic_magnitude Concentration arsenic detected water sample arsenic_units Units used measure arsenic concentration (e.g., ug/L) ammonia_mg_per_l Ammonia concentration mg per liter fluoride_ppm Fluoride concentration parts per million nitrate_mg_per_l Nitrate concentration mg per liter total_dissolved_solids_ppt Total dissolved solids parts per thousand free_chlorine_mg_per_l Concentration free chlorine mg per water sample (e.g., well, tap, river) date_of_sample Date water sample collected ecoli_mpn_per_100ml probable number (MPN) E. coli bacteria per 100 milliliters ecoli_upper_95ci_per_100ml Upper limit
